content.description:
Most of the route is class three with the odd move of four. It is also possible to get around the steep grade 5- curtain on the right.

Heading West on Hwy 16 from Terrace a large rock wall can be seen before crossing the Exchamsiks bridge. Sometimes a large volume of ice freezes up. When it does and your not worried about ice daggers falling on your head, get out there for a route called Deep Freeze. Park on West side of bridge in the entrance to the boat launch. This area is usually plowed.
Ice screws

I'm calling it 'Exchamsiks Big Bend' as a description to it's location. 
  
 I didn't have a rope mate when I found this route so I didn't get a chance to finish it (not brave enough to solo the whole thing). Swung my picks on the lower sections. It looked and felt like WI3/4 and about 80 feet tall. I guess I'll let the picture do the talking until someone sends it and puts up a description.

It's just off the highway up the hill about 50 yards. Perfectly safe from traffic but still visible to passing cars.
It looks like it will take all length screws, and mabey even a V-thread at the top.
Along the highway just west of the 'Exchamsiks Backchannel Rehabilitation' sign by a huge rock bulge over hanging the highway.
